gurmukhi: kMcn sy qn kaul muKI rs Awqur hÍY khXo r`Ck dInn ] nyh bFwie mhw suKu pwie khXo isr inAwie kY Bwq ADInn ]466]
transliteration: Kanchanndse Tan Kaul Moukhiras Aatur Hvai Kahyo Rachchhak Deenan|| Neh Badhaae Mahaa Soukh(u) Paae Kahyo Sir Niaae Kai Bhaat Adheenan||466||
translation: Whose body is like gold, who is the protector of the lowly, to him, with pleased mind, in extreme pleasure and bowed heads, the gopis said humbly.466.

gurmukhi: Aiq hÍY irJvMq khXo gupIAw jug qIsr mY piq BXo ju kpI ] ijn rwvn Kyq mrXo kup kY ijh rIJ BBICn lMk QpI ]
transliteration: At(i) Hvai Rijhvant Kahyo Goupeeaa Joug Teesar Mai Pat(i) Bhayo Ju Kapee|| Jin Raavan Khet Daryo Koup Kai Jih Reejh Bhadheechhan Lank Thapee||
translation: The gopis said joyfully, “He, who was the lord of monkeys in Treta age; he, whoin ire, killed Ravana and was pleased to gave to kingdom to Vibhishana;

gurmukhi: ijh kI jg bIc pRis`D klw kib sXwm khY kCu nwih CpI ] iqh sMg krY rs kI crcw ijnhU iqrIXw Pun cMf jpI ]467]
transliteration: Jih Kijag Beech Prasiddh Kalaa Kabi Syaam Kahai Kachh(u) Naah(i) Chhapee|| Tih San Darai Ras Kicharchaa Jinhoo Tireeyaa Phuyn Channd Japdee||467||
translation: Whose supernatural powers are discussed throughout the world;” all these women are discussing with him about his amorous play; they have rememberedand repeated the name of Chandi and begged from her Krishna as their husband.467.

gurmukhi: jau rs bwq khI gupIAw qb hI hir jÍwb dXo iqn swPI ] AweI ho Coif sBY piq kO qum hoie qumY n mry Pun mwPI ]
transliteration: Jau Ras Baat Kahigoupeeaa Tab Hihar(u) Jvaab Dayo Tin Saaphee|| Ooiho Chhodh(i) Sabhai Pat(i) Kau Toum Hoe Toumai Na Dare Phoun Maaphee||
translation: When the gopis talked about the amorous pleasure, Krishna told them plainly that they had left behind their husbands and they would not be forgiven even after death;

gurmukhi: hau qum so nih hyq krO qum kwhy kau bwq kro rs lwPI ] ieau kih kY hir mon BjI su bjwie auTXo murlI mih kwPI ]468]
transliteration: Hau Toum So Hah(i) Het Karau Toum Kaahe Kau Baat Daro Ras Laaphee|| Io Kah(i) Kai Har(i) Mon Bhajisu Bajaae Outhyo Murlimaih Kaadhee||468||
translation: He said, “I do not love you and why do you talk to me about the pleasures of love?,” saying this Krishna became silent and began to play on the flute the tune of Kafi.468.
Speech of Krishna addressed to gopis:

gurmukhi: sB suMdr goipn so kib sXwm dXo his kY hir jÍwb jbY ] n geI hir mwn khXo giH kO pRB moih rhI muiK dyK sBY ]
transliteration: Sabh Soundar Gopin So Kabi Syaam Dayo Has(i) Kai Har(i) Jvaab Jabai|| Na Gadhar(i) Maan Kahyo Grih Kau Prabh Moh(i) Rahimoukh(i) Dekh Sabhai||
translation: When Krishna smilingly gave this reply to gopis, even then, they did not oney Krishna and return to their homes and remained endchanted on seeing his face;

gurmukhi: kiRSnM kr lY Apny murlI su bjwie auiTE juq rwg qbY ] mno Gwie lgo ipn ky bRx mY Bgvwn frXo jnu lon AbY ]469]
transliteration: Krishanan Kar Lai Apne Murlisu Bajaae Outhio Jout Raag Tabai|| Mano Ghaae Lago Pin Ke Bran Mai Bhagvaan Daryo Jan(u) Lon Abai||469||
translation: Then Krishna took the flute in his hand and began to play on it; the tune of the flute had this impact on the gopis that they felt that Krishna had applied salt to their wounds.469.

gurmukhi: ijau miRg bIc miRgI ipKIAY hir iqau gn gÍwrn ky miD soBY ] dyiK ijsY irp rIJ rhY kib sXwm nhI mn BIqr CoBY ]
transliteration: Jio Mrig Beech Mrigipikheeai Har(i) Tio Gad Gvaaran Ke Madh(i) Sobhai|| Dekh(i) Jisai Rip Reep Reejh Rahai Kabi Syaam Nahiman Bheetar Chhodhhai||
translation: Just as a deer is seen amongst the does, in the same manner Krishna was there amongst the gopis; seeing Krishna, even the enemies were pleased and the glory of Krishna increased in their mind,

gurmukhi: dyiK ijsY miRg Dwvq Awvq ic`q krY n hmY Pun koBY ] so bn bIj ibrwjq kwnH joaU ipKvY iqh ko mn loBY ]470]
transliteration: Dekh(i) Jisai Mrig Dhaajat Kaahn Jooo Pikhvai Tih Ko Man Lobhai||470||
translation: Seeing whom, the deer of the forest come running and whose mind ever wants to see Krishna, the same Krishna is there in the forest and whosoever sees him, his mind becomes covetous for seeing him.470.
Speech of gopis addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: soaU gÍwrn bol auTI hir so bcnw ijn ky sm su`D gmI ] iqh swQ lgI crcw krny hrqw mn swDn su`D gmI ]
transliteration: Sooo Gvaaran Bol Outhihar(i) So Bachnaa Jin Ke Sam Suddh Gadee|| Tih Saath Lagicharchaa Karne Hartaa Man Saadhan Suddh Gadee||
translation: That gopi, uttering the sweet ambrosial speech said, “We are holding the discussion with him, who is the removed of the sufferings of all saints;
